Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a UDP socket for SNMP communication, capable of sending and receiving datagram packets asynchronously while handling errors and resource cleanup properly.

Class Description: The SnmpSocket class provides UDP socket functionality for SNMP communication, managing packet transmission and reception in a separate thread. It includes methods for sending packets, checking socket validity, and proper resource cleanup. The class implements Runnable to handle incoming packets asynchronously.

Attributes:
_socket: [DatagramSocket] - The UDP socket instance for communication
_dgramHdlr: [SnmpResponseHandler] - Handler for processing received datagrams
_sockThread: [Thread] - Thread for asynchronous packet reception
_buffer: [byte[]] - Buffer for storing incoming packet data
isClosing: [boolean] - Flag indicating if the socket is being closed
_socketPort: [int] - Port number the socket is bound to
responseBufSize: [int] - Size of the response buffer

Methods:
Constructor: [SnmpSocket](SnmpResponseHandler rspHdlr, InetAddress addr, int bufferSize) -> [void] - Initializes the UDP socket and starts the receiver thread
sendPacket: [sendPacket](byte[] buff, int length, InetAddress addr, int port) -> [void] - Sends a datagram packet with specified data to given address and port
sendPacket: [sendPacket](DatagramPacket dgrmpkt) -> [void] - Sends a prepared datagram packet
isValid: [isValid]() -> [boolean] - Checks if the socket is in a valid state
close: [close]() -> [void] - Closes the socket and cleans up resources
run: [run]() -> [void] - Main thread method for receiving packets (implements Runnable)
finalize: [finalize]() -> [void] - Ensures proper cleanup when object is garbage collected
handleJavaError: [handleJavaError](Throwable thr) -> [void] - Handles Java errors during operation
handleDatagram: [handleDatagram](DatagramPacket dgrmpkt) -> [void] - Processes received datagrams using the response handler
